item.title: CrowdStrike says it will lay off 500 workers
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The cybersecurity company said it will lay off 5% of its global workforce.

item.title: The web series is back – only this time, they’re TikToks
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: “Day 25 of starting over my whole entire life,” Raegan Lynch narrates over a short video. “Right now, I’m wandering around the city I just moved to, in a country I’d never seen, all by myself after my relationship ended, and I had to leave my old life behind.” It’s a pretty enticing hook, which […]

item.title: Mistral claims its newest AI model delivers leading performance for the price
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: French AI startup Mistral is releasing a new AI model, Mistral Medium 3, that’s focused on efficiency without compromising performance. Available in Mistral’s API priced at $0.40 per million input tokens and $20.80 per million output tokens, Mistral Medium 3 performs “at or above” 90% of Anthropic’s costlier Claude Sonnet 3.7 model on “benchmarks across […]

item.title: Spotify’s latest update gives users more control over their listening experience
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Spotify on Wednesday announced an update to its app designed to give users more control over their listening experience and recommendations. The refreshed experience introduces a handful of new features that will roll out gradually to Spotify users and Premium subscribers, including those to help you manage your Queue, your current listening experience, aid with […]

item.title: Ford hikes Mustang Mach-E price due to Trump’s tariffs
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Ford is raising the price of the all-electric Mustang Mach-E SUV and popular entry-level Maverick pickup by as much as $2,000 due to the import taxes President Donald Trump is placing on vehicles made in Mexico, according to Reuters. Higher prices could make it harder for traditional automakers like Ford to sell their EVs. Ford […]

item.title: Trump admin plans to shutter money-saving Energy Star program
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The program’s signature yellow labels appear on appliances and electronics for sale throughout the U.S.

item.title: Game, Sett, Funding: a startup building AI agents for game development emerges from stealth with $27M
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description: Games drove the creation of GPU processors back in the 1990s, so it’s only fitting that artificial intelligence — the technology that GPUs are used to power nowadays — is making its way into nearly every aspect of video game design. In keeping with that trend, on Wednesday a startup called Sett — which is […]

item.title: VSCO is launching an AI-powered collaborative moodboard
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Photo and video editing platform VSCO has launched an AI-powered collaborative moodboard to expand how its products are used by photographers and artists.

item.title: AI data startup WisdomAI nabs $23M with a smart way to avoid hallucinations
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Rubrik co-founder Soham Mazumdar has a new data startup called Wisdom AI. It offers an agentic data analyst that works with structured, unstructured, even “dirty” data.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg’s AI ad tool sounds like a social media nightmare
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Tech executives have long talked about how AI is going to revolutionize the advertising industry. In particularly, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has been quite vocal about how exactly he wants his company to lead the transformation. Speaking onstage at Stripe’s annual Sessions conference in San Francisco on Tuesday, Zuckerberg laid out his plans to automate […]

item.title: Breathe lands $21M Series B to predict battery performance
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Breathe has developed a suite of tools that it says helps automakers and others get the most out of their batteries.

item.title: Netflix debuts its generative AI-powered search tool
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: After hinting at a new AI-powered search experience during its recent earnings call, Netflix officially unveiled the feature at its tech and product event on Wednesday. This new search experience will utilize OpenAI’s ChatGPT to provide users with a conversational discovery experience. Users can enter their preferences using natural phrases like “I want something funny […]

item.title: Netflix is getting into short videos with a new vertical feed for mobile
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Netflix announced on Wednesday that it’s testing a short-form video feature, signaling that even a streaming giant with over 300 million subscribers is concerned about losing viewers’ time spent on mobile to apps like TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and Instagram Reels. The company debuted the feature at its first-ever product and tech event, where it also […]

item.title: Kapor Capital’s managing partner Ulili Onovakpuri is leaving the firm
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Kapor Capital’s managing partner Ulili Onovakpuri said yesterday that she is leaving the firm.  Onovakpuri started as a principal at Kapor Capital more than a decade ago, and rose through the ranks to become managing partner, and eventually (with Brian Dixon) took over the reins from the firm’s co-founders Mitch Kapor and Freada Kapor Klein.  […]

item.title: Ox Security lands a fresh $60M to scan for vulnerabilities in code
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: As “vibe coding” gains in popularity and tech companies push devs in their employ to embrace generative AI tools, a platform that scans for vulnerabilities in AI-generated code has raised a fresh round of funding. Ox Security, which models risk across both AI- and human-produced code, on Wednesday announced that it closed a $60 million […]

item.title: Mitsubishi in talks to source its new EVs for Australia, New Zealand from Foxconn unit
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Mitsubishi Motors is in talks with Taiwan-based Foxconn's EV division to source an EV model for the Australia and New Zealand markets.

item.title: Amazon is working on an AI code generation tool
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Amazon Web Services is building a new AI-powered code generation tool codenamed “Kiro,” Business Insider reported, citing internal documents it had viewed. The tool can use prompts and existing data to generate code in “near real-time” by connecting with AI agents, the report said. The tool is said to have web and desktop apps, multimodal […]

item.title: OpenAI expects to cut share of revenue it pays Microsoft by 2030
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: OpenAI currently has a deal to share 20% of revenue with Microsoft, but the AI company expects to cut that share to 10% by 2030, The Information reported.

item.title: Amid Greek tech boom, a prominent seed-stage firm locks down €75 million
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Marathon Venture Capital, a venture firm in Athens that prides itself on being “day one partners to Greek tech partners,” just closed its newest fund with €75 million in capital commitments, according to partner Panos Papadopoulos. The vehicle brings the firm’s total assets under management to €175 million — a meaningful amount for an eight-year-old, […]

item.title: Hugging Face releases a free Operator-like agentic AI tool
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: A team at Hugging Face has released a freely available, cloud-hosted computer-using AI “agent.” But be forewarned: It’s quite sluggish and occasionally makes mistakes. Hugging Face’s agent, called Open Computer Agent, is accessible via the web and can use a Linux virtual machine preloaded with several applications, including Firefox. Similar to OpenAI’s Operator, you can […]
